info.name: Azure DDMS OSDU Smoke Tests
info.description:
Exploring Authorization API in OSDU. This collection allows doing the following requests:

1) Getting access and id tokens (aihtorization code flow)
2) Discover OpenID Connect configuration
3) Refreshing tokens
4) Making secured User Info request (to validate the token)

item.name: Register Datapartition in Seismic Store for File Metadata

request.description: Register the datapartition with the seismic storage.

body.raw:
{
    "name": "testlegaltag01010",
    "description": "Legal Tag added for File Metadata testing",
    "properties": {
        "contractId": "123456",
        "countryOfOrigin": [
            "US",
            "CA"
        ],
        "dataType": "Public Domain Data",
        "exportClassification": "EAR99",
        "originator": "MSFT",
        "personalData": "No Personal Data",
        "securityClassification": "Private",
        "expirationDate": "2025-12-25"
    }
}

request.description: Verify that the SEGY file successfully finished uploading to the seismic storage.

item.description:
A new OSDU instance will require certain configurations and files to perform a SEGY to ZGY conversion. This group of requests will setup all requirements, including uploading a sample SEGY file to storage if necessary. These tests use a sample SEGY file provided by Equinor (*ST10010ZC11_PZ_PSDM_KIRCH_FULL_T.MIG_FIN.POST_STACK.3D.JS-017536.segy*). Be sure to download this file from [Equinor's Volve field data set](https://www.equinor.com/energy/volve-data-sharing)*, add the "sample-" prefix to the file name, and then add the file to your test directory. Alternatively, you can download the sample SEGY file from this repository using git LFS.

Your SEGY file should be in the same directory as the test collection when running tests using Newman:

*   (your test directory)
    *   *.postman_collection.json
    *   *.postman_environment.json
    *   sample-ST10010ZC11_PZ_PSDM_KIRCH_FULL_T.MIG_FIN.POST_STACK.3D.JS-017536.segy

If you will be using Postman to run your tests, you should set the test directory as the working directory for Postman or move the sample SEGY file to a **test** folder in the **Postman** directory

*Follow the dataset download instructions, and find them inside folder Seismic/ST10010/Stacks.

item.name: Seismic DDMS ZGY Conversion: Smoke Tests

request.description: Before we start conversion, we need to ensure that the file is unlocked and ready for use.
Remotely trigger the ZGY DAG to convert the SEGY file to a ZGY file.

exec: console.log("Stop polling conversion status. Process may be hanging.")

request.description: Check the status of the DAG to verify that conversion is finished. If the DAG is still processing, this request will retry every minute until the response no longer shows a status of "running" (up to 6 minutes). After all attempts, we will assume that the DAG is hanging and give up if we do not receive a successful status.

exec: let numberOfConversionFiles = 3; // as in, found *segy.idx, *segy.idx.bin, and *.zgy

query.description: full path for the subproject in the seismic store

request.description: ZGY conversion produces a single file ZGY along with a couple reference files, and this request will verify that the files exist after a successful conversion.
We'll check the ZGY dataset to make sure that it isn't an empty file and compares to the SEGY file's size.

item.description: This group of requests will start ZGY conversion and verify success.

item.name: Seismic DDMS ZGY Conversion: Teardown

request.description: After conversion has been verified, we must remove all data files that were added to the seismic storage (including the sample SEGY file). Check the *`zgy_file_names_to_delete`* environment variable. If it contains an array- a string of values separated by a comma(,)- then you can manually run this request multiple times until all files are deleted.

exec: pm.test("Status code is 204 No Content", function () {

request.description: We remove the test record after conversion is verified since it is no longer needed. Check the `zgy_record_IDs_to_delete` environment variable. If it contains an array- a string of values separated by a comma(,)- then you can manually run this request multiple times until all records are deleted.

header.description: This value should be the desired data partition id.

request.description: We remove the test legal tag after conversion is verified since it is no longer needed.
We remove the test subproject that was created in the seismic storage since it is no longer needed.

item.description: Remove all artifacts created for tests. If any request in this folder did not complete successfully, you should retry running the entire folder to ensure a total teardown.

This set of tests will setup and tear down all configurations and files needed for SEGY to ZGY conversion, including a sample SEGY file. User or system must provide an OAUTH token (TOKEN variable) to authenticate each request.

item.description:
A new OSDU instance will require certain configurations and files to perform a SEGY to VDS conversion. This group of requests will setup all requirements, including uploading a sample SEGY file to storage if necessary. These tests use a sample SEGY file provided by Equinor (*ST10010ZC11_PZ_PSDM_KIRCH_FULL_T.MIG_FIN.POST_STACK.3D.JS-017536.segy*). Be sure to download this file from [Equinor's Volve field data set](https://www.equinor.com/energy/volve-data-sharing)*, add the "example-" prefix to the file name, and then add the file to your test directory. Alternatively, you can download the sample SEGY file from this repository using git LFS.

Your SEGY file should be in the same directory as the test collection when running tests using Newman:

*   (your test directory)
    *   *.postman_collection.json
    *   *.postman_environment.json
    *   example-ST10010ZC11_PZ_PSDM_KIRCH_FULL_T.MIG_FIN.POST_STACK.3D.JS-017536.segy

If you will be using Postman to run your tests, you should set the test directory as the working directory for Postman or move the sample SEGY file to a **test** folder in the **Postman** directory

*Follow the dataset download instructions, and find them inside folder Seismic/ST10010/Stacks.

item.description: Remove all artifacts created for tests. If any request in this folder did not complete successfully, you should retry running the entire folder to ensure a total teardown. This set of tests *does not* remove the reference artifact directory that is created outside of the subproject- that directory must be removed manually.

This set of tests will setup and tear down all configurations and files needed for SEGY to VDS conversion, including a sample SEGY file. User or system must provide an OAUTH token (TOKEN variable) to authenticate each request.

response.name: entity_create well

header.value: [origin, content-type, accept, authorization, data-partition-id, correlation-id, appkey]

body.raw:
{
    "id": "{{DATA_PARTITION_ID}}:master-data--Wellbore:{{welldelivery_wellbore_id}}",
    "kind": "osdu:wks:master-data--Wellbore:1.0.0",
    "acl": {
        "owners": [
            "data.default.owners@{{entitlement_domain}}"
        ],
        "viewers": [
            "data.default.viewers@{{entitlement_domain}}"
        ]
    },
    "legal": {
        "legaltags": [
            "{{legal_dafault_tag}}"
        ],
        "otherRelevantDataCountries": [
            "US"
        ],
        "status": "compliant"
    },
    "tags": {
        "NameOfKey": "String value"
    },
    "createTime": "2020-12-16T11:46:20.163Z",
    "createUser": "some-user@some-company-cloud.com",
    "modifyTime": "2020-12-16T11:52:24.477Z",
    "modifyUser": "some-user@some-company-cloud.com",
    "ancestry": {
        "parents": []
    },
    "meta": [
        {
            "kind": "Unit",
            "name": "m",
            "persistableReference": "{\"abcd\":{\"a\":0.0,\"b\":1.0,\"c\":1.0,\"d\":0.0},\"symbol\":\"m\",\"baseMeasurement\":{\"ancestry\":\"L\",\"type\":\"UM\"},\"type\":\"UAD\"}",
            "unitOfMeasureID": "namespace:reference-data--UnitOfMeasure:m:",
            "propertyNames": [
                "FacilitySpecifications[0].FacilitySpecificationQuantity",
                "VerticalMeasurements[0].VerticalMeasurement"
            ]
        }
    ],
    "data": {
        "ResourceHomeRegionID": "namespace:reference-data--OSDURegion:AWSEastUSA:",
        "ResourceHostRegionIDs": [
            "namespace:reference-data--OSDURegion:AWSEastUSA:"
        ],
        "ResourceCurationStatus": "namespace:reference-data--ResourceCurationStatus:CREATED:",
        "ResourceLifecycleStatus": "namespace:reference-data--ResourceLifecycleStatus:LOADING:",
        "ResourceSecurityClassification": "namespace:reference-data--ResourceSecurityClassification:RESTRICTED:",

            {

                "TerminationDateTime": "2020-02-13T09:13:15.55Z"

        ],

            {

        ],

            "SpatialLocationCoordinatesDate": "2020-02-13T09:13:15.55Z",
            "QuantitativeAccuracyBandID": "namespace:reference-data--QuantitativeAccuracyBand:Length.LessThan1m:",
            "QualitativeSpatialAccuracyTypeID": "namespace:reference-data--QualitativeSpatialAccuracyType:Confirmed:",

                "Example CoordinateQualityCheckRemarks"
            ],

                "type": "AnyCrsFeatureCollection",
